titleStmt.title: The charge of high treason, murders, oppressions, and other crimes, exhibited to the Parliament of Scotland against the Marquess of Argyle and his complices, January 23. 1661.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II)

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Richard Lowndes, at the White Lion in St. Pauls Church-yard, near the little North doore,

notesStmt.note: Dated at end: Given under our Signet at Edinburgh, the twenty eighth day of December, and of our reign the twelfth year, 1660.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "feb: 18. 1660"; imprint date crossed through.
Reproductions of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the White Lion in St. Pauls Church-yard, near the little North doore
